page.title: 19IBTHORPE - VILLAGE
page.content: Horseshoe Lane in{Ibthorpe}is the site of a mediaeval village, and is a mixture of very old and new houses. The old houses which remain each have their original 'strip' of land. New houses have been built across 'strips' vacated when the original wattle and daub cottages disappeared with time. At one end of Horseshoe Lane is the Bank Tree. This has been a meeting place since Saxon times. At the beginning of this century, the bank was maintained and the tree pollarded. The wood was given to the local people It is also possible that farm workers gathered at the Bank Tree to receive their pay. The Methodist Chapel held open air services there on Sunday evenings in summer within living memory.
